intro: Antholyza sudanica, commonly known as Sudanese antholyza, is a flowering plant native to the Sahel region of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while the flowers are small and clustered in a head. Antholyza sudanica is often found in sandy soils and can be a component of local vegetation in dry ecosystems.
